summary: An email from an individual (sender redacted) to a recipient (redacted) discussing past events, including taking pictures of people they believed were spying on them, sharing copies with someone named Len, and recalling an event in New Orleans during Mardi Gras involving a 'Jimmy Saville event' and a trade show where they saw a woman described as a famous children's book author.

persons.name: Len
persons.context: The email author states they typically made two copies of pictures, one for themselves and one for Len, and speculates that Len has the whole series of photos.

persons.name: Jimmy Saville
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of an event in New Orleans, referred to as 'the jimmy saville event' coinciding with a trade show during Mardi Gras.

connections.description: The email author shared photographs with Len, indicating a collaborative or trusting relationship regarding documentation.

events.title: Suspected Surveillance Incident
events.description: The email author describes a past experience where they believed they and others were being spied on, leading them to take pictures of the suspected individuals.

events.title: New Orleans Trade Show Event
events.description: Recollection of being at a hotel in New Orleans during Mardi Gras for a trade show and a 'Jimmy Saville event', where photographers took pictures of a woman described as a famous children's book author exiting an elevator.

keyFacts: The email author describes a pattern of making duplicate copies of photographs, one for themselves and one for an associate named Len.
The author recalls a specific event in New Orleans involving a 'Jimmy Saville event' and a trade show during Mardi Gras.
At the New Orleans event, photographers took pictures of a woman identified as a famous children's book author and someone's girlfriend.
The document references EFTA case numbers (EFTA00099869, EFTA00099870, EFTA00099871), indicating it is part of a larger evidence set.
